meanings.definition: A tropical American plant of the nightshade family, with poisonous black berries.
meanings.sent1: The stramony plant in the garden has dark berries that are not safe to eat.
meanings.sent2: The farmer warned the children not to touch the stramony plant due to its toxic berries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the stramony berries for nuts and had a very upset stomach.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like the stramony berries, beautiful but poisonous if taken in.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the stramony berries served as a warning to all who passed by.

meanings.definition: A preparation of the dried leaves and stems of the stramony plant, used as a medicine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a dose of stramony to help with the patient's cough.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, stramony was a common remedy for various ailments.
meanings.sent3: The grandmother joked that a spoonful of stramony would cure any ailment, even a broken heart.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the stramony medicine filled the room, promising relief to the sick child.
meanings.sent5: The ancient book mentioned the healing properties of stramony, passed down through generations.
